Award.AwardTitle: Mid-Atlantic Algebra, Geometry, and Combinatorics Workshop
Award.AbstractNarration:
This grant provides support for speakers and participants in the Mid-Atlantic Algebra, Geometry, and Combinatorics (MAAGC) workshop, the next of which will take place at Drexel University on May 5-6, 2017. MAAGC is an annual conference series held in Philadelphia which brings together senior researchers and junior mathematicians to promote collaborations and regional interactions, while highlighting recent significant developments in algebra, geometry, and combinatorics. Each MAAGC workshop has brought four outstanding mathematicians from across North America to give talks about new advances in algebraic combinatorics, algebraic geometry, representation theory, and other related fields. In addition to these invited lectures, there is a poster session for junior participants, a panel discussion featuring concrete and timely professional advice for mathematicians at varying stages in their careers, and plenty of unstructured time for forging mathematical collaborations.

MAAGC workshops are designed to strengthen and connect the scientific communities in algebra, geometry, and combinatorics by facilitating positive interactions among students, postdocs, and faculty at research universities as well as small colleges in the Mid-Atlantic. We aim to include even more graduate student and postdoctoral participants throughout the region, providing early career researchers the opportunity to learn about recent trends in the field, disseminate their own work, build professional connections, and advance new mathematical results. The majority of the budget is thus dedicated toward funding students and young researchers without other means of financial support, prioritizing participants who also present posters. This grant will support the MAAGC conference series for three years (2017, 2018, 2019).

More information is available on the MAAGC website at http://www.maagc.info.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The MAAGC Workshop is an outgrowth of the Philadelphia Combinatorics & Algebraic Geometry (CAGE) seminar, a weekly seminar that began in 2008, co-organized by Drexel University, Haverford College, Swarthmore College, the University of Pennsylvania and University of Virginia. MAAGC aims to bring together senior researchers and junior mathematicians from the region to exchange ideas and forge collaborations in algebraic geometry and algebraic combinatorics.


It is a 1.5 day-long workshop. It consists of four invited talks, a poster session for junior participants (undergraduate and graduate students as well as postdocs), all while allowing for plenty of time for informal discussions.  In addition, there is a panel discussion, which features concrete, candid advice for mathematicians at varying stages in the profession (e.g. finding jobs, getting grants, starting collaborations).

The NSF grant has allowed us to invite high-profile speakers from all over the US including Lauren Williams (Harvard) and Sergey Fomin (UMichigan). It included junior and senior participants from all the neighboring states . The students received funding for local travel and housing.  Usually it has been held on a Friday/Saturday the last week of April or first week of May. There is one talk on Friday and 3 talks, panel discussion and poster session on Saturday.


Details on the speakers, schedule and participants is here:

http://www.maagc.info/philadelphia-2016
